channel.title: Comments on: The crux of the matter – language, context, and narrative

item.title: By: kindredspirit23
item.dc:creator: kindredspirit23
item.description: I often feel/ have felt the unnecessary language used in sciences, especially for papers. A lot of what I have read in, say, psychological papers is almost a necessity to make the paper so difficult that the average person can read the words, but the meaning will elude him/her. This is not good communication. This is being somewhat conceited as a science. People want to know what's going on and how and why...this is a way. Just speak as a person would who didn't have a PH.D. Scott
item.content:encoded:
I often feel/ have felt the unnecessary language used in sciences, especially for papers. A lot of what I have read in, say, psychological papers is almost a necessity to make the paper so difficult that the average person can read the words, but the meaning will elude him/her. This is not good communication. This is being somewhat conceited as a science. People want to know what’s going on and how and why…this is a way. Just speak as a person would who didn’t have a PH.D.
Scott
